articles.author: Patricia Laya,Austin Weinstein
articles.title: Trump’s Immigration Policy Makes Jobs Goal Even Tougher to Reach
articles.description: President Donald Trump’s pledge to create 25 million jobs in a decade already faces obstacles ranging from a tight labor market to an aging population. His immigration policy raises the hurdles even higher.

articles.author: Hugh Son,Jennifer Surane,Francine Lacqua
articles.title: Dimon Says Trump Has Reawakened ‘Animal Spirits’ in the U.S.
articles.description: Jamie Dimon said President Trump’s economic agenda has ignited U.S. business and consumer confidence and he expects at least some of the administration’s proposals to be enacted.

articles.author: Luke Kawa,Sid Verma
articles.title: The Market Is Suddenly Having Second Thoughts on Reflation
articles.description: There’s a rebellion against reflation brewing in financial markets, with many Trump trades having a, um, crude awakening this week.

articles.author: Eli Lake
articles.title: Trump's Run of Dumb Luck
articles.description: Accusing his predecessor of spying on him wasn't a smart move. But it inadvertently prompted officials to clear his name.

articles.author: Alex Longley
articles.title: The OPEC Deal Is Facing Its Biggest Test
articles.description: OPEC’s strategy to balance the oil market and bolster prices is facing its biggest test.

articles.author: Oshrat Carmiel
articles.title: Manhattan Rents Fall for Every Apartment Size, Even Studios
articles.description: Rents fell last month for Manhattan apartments of all sizes, the first across-the-board price decline in at least four years, as a construction boom brought more buildings to market and allowed some tenants to leave for bigger or newer units.

articles.author: Sonali Basak,Lisa Du,Katherine Chiglinsky
articles.title: As Icahn Prevails, One of These Managers May Be Next to Lead AIG
articles.description: It’s been 17 months since activist Carl Icahn started targeting American International Group Inc.’s Chief Executive Officer Peter Hancock, faulting him for the company’s sluggish returns and pressuring him to sell assets. The CEO announced his resignation Thursday after posting losses in four of the past six quarters.

articles.author: Craig Giammona
articles.title: Why Big Brands Couldn’t Stop Chobani From Winning the Yogurt War
articles.description: Yoplait is suffering through a Greek crisis.

articles.author: Michael Smith,Jonathan Franklin
articles.title: How to Become an International Gold Smuggler
articles.description: Harold Vilches, a 23-year-old Chilean, exported $80 million in contraband gold. It all started with a Google search.

articles.title: These States Aren’t Waiting for Trump to Get Funds for Infrastructure
articles.description: They say they can’t count on Trump’s $1 trillion plan to deliver what they need.
